decision_conditions: The proposed development by reason of its limited plot size, location and the design of front fenestrations / and garage rolllershuttter fronting The Square would constitute an incongruous and wholly inappropriate form of residential development inconsistent with the prevailing pattern of development within the immediate area. In addition proposed development which would be experienced as a single storey property would be uncharacteristic of the area. As such, the proposal would also fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of this part of the Carshalton Village Conservation Area, contrary to the provisions of Carshalton Village Conservation Area Character Appraisal and Management Plan, and Policies 28 and 30 of the Sutton's Local Plan and Sutton's Urban Design Guide Supplementary Planning Document (SPD) 14 "Creating Locally Distinctive Places".

The proposed development would provide unsatisfactory living conditions for the future occupiers of the proposed dwellings, by reason of lack of defensible space at the front of the site, and would therefore fail to provide a high standard of living accommodation for the future occupiers of these dwellings. The proposal would therefore be contrary to Policy D6 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy 9 of Sutton's Local Plan 2018, and Sutton's Urban Design Guide Supplementary Planning Document (SPD) 14 "Creating Locally Distinctive Places".
description: Change of use from Class B8 (warehouse/storage) to Class C3 (residential) to provide a single storey self contained unit including the installation of rooflights to the flat roof, provision of an integrated front/flank garage and cycle store, refuse storage area to front and amenity area to rear.
application_type_full: Full planning & demolition in a conservation area
